EZZY'S TRANSMISSION

My name is Ezzy Klein. I used to read tarot at psychic fairs in strip malls where the ceiling tiles were always water-damaged and the energy was always weird but not in a mystical way. Then I met Barnaby at a conference about internet misinformation and we got drunk and decided to build this site. That was 2017.

The idea was simple: what if we made the conspiracy-board aesthetic into an actual tool? Let people map their theories. Red string. Thumbtacks. The whole paranoid detective aesthetic. We thought it would be funny. Then we thought it would be useful. Then we realized it was both and neither.

Barnaby disappeared in 2021. Not in a mysterious way — he just stopped answering emails and his phone went to voicemail and eventually I got a postcard from Sedona that said "the vortexes are real but not how you think." I haven't heard from him since. The cat he kept posting about turned out to be a stock photo he'd been using as a bit. I still don't know why.

Here's what I know: we are all one bad week away from buying the conspiracy. You lose your job, your relationship ends, your back hurts in a new way, your insurance denies the claim — and suddenly the idea that someone is in control, even if they're evil, is more comforting than the truth, which is that nobody's driving and the bus is on fire and we're all just holding on.

This site isn't here to debunk anything. It's not here to convince you. It's here because the impulse to connect things is human and sometimes the connections are real and sometimes they're not but the need to make sense of the senseless is what keeps us going. Or what breaks us. Depends on the day.

So go ahead. Draw your strings. Map your theories. Make your diagrams. I'll keep the server running. Barnaby's gone. The cat was never real. But the thumbtacks are real. The cork board is real. Your need to understand is real. Start there.

— Ezzy Klein, sole remaining administrator

This site runs on a single DigitalOcean droplet and my slowly depleting savings.

if you've ever felt seen by the chaos, consider keeping the lights on.
